page.title: 16CHILTON FARM NR. BRIGHSTONE
page.content: Chilton farm has 530 acres of land which are a mixture of arable land and grazing. The farm breeds Jersey cows, their herd is said to be the oldest in England.The farmer's wife rears the calves and tends to the domestic animals including dogs, cats and tortoises. The farm used to keep pigs but now it has dairy cows and beef cattle.The farm grows grass for hay and for silage. It has a special machine to harvest these crops. They also have a combined harvester for the crops of barley and wheat. The family all agreed that Brighstone was a very friendly village in which to live.The son belongs to a chess club and the daughter is a Brownie. The village is small and quiet and the farmer's wife shops once a week in Newport and monthly on the mainland.
